org.apache.hama.bsp.taskallocation

Interface TaskAllocationStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BestEffortDataLocalTaskAllocator

    @InterfaceStability.Unstable
public interface TaskAllocationStrategy
    TaskAllocationStrategy defines the behavior of task allocation strategy that is employed by a Hama job to schedule tasks in GroomServers in Hama cluster. The function selectGrooms is responsible to define the strategy to select the grooms. This list of grooms could be used in the functions getGroomToAllocate or getGroomsToAllocate in the parameter selectedGrooms. The two functions are not given the responsibility to select grooms because these functions could also be handling the task of allocating tasks on any other restricted set of grooms that the caller invokes them for.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<GroomServerStatus> getGroomsToAllocate(Map<String,GroomServerStatus> groomStatuses, String[] selectedGrooms, Map<GroomServerStatus,Integer> taskCountInGroomMap, BSPResource[] resources, TaskInProgress taskInProgress)
      Returns the best grooms to run the task on based on the set of grooms provided.
      GroomServerStatus getGroomToAllocate(Map<String,GroomServerStatus> groomStatuses, String[] selectedGrooms, Map<GroomServerStatus,Integer> taskCountInGroomMap, BSPResource[] resources, TaskInProgress taskInProgress)
      Returns the best groom to run the task on based on the set of grooms provided.
      void initialize(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
      Initializes the TaskAllocationStrategy instance.
      String[] selectGrooms(Map<String,GroomServerStatus> groomStatuses, Map<GroomServerStatus,Integer> taskCountInGroomMap, BSPResource[] resources, TaskInProgress taskInProgress)

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
        Initializes the TaskAllocationStrategy instance.
        Parameters:
        conf - Hama configuration

      • selectGrooms

        @InterfaceStability.Unstable
String[] selectGrooms(Map<String,GroomServerStatus> groomStatuses,
                                                Map<GroomServerStatus,Integer> taskCountInGroomMap,
                                                BSPResource[] resources,
                                                TaskInProgress taskInProgress)
        Defines the task-allocation strategy to select the grooms based on the resource constraints and the task related restrictions posed. This function could be used to populate the selectedGrooms argument in the functions getGroomToAllocate and getGroomsToAllocate
        Parameters:
        groomStatuses - The map of groom-name to GroomServerStatus object for all known grooms.
        taskCountInGroomMap - Map of count of tasks in groom (To be deprecated soon)
        taskInProgress - The TaskInProgress object for the task.
        Returns:
        An array of hostnames where the tasks could be allocated on.

      • getGroomToAllocate

        @InterfaceStability.Unstable
GroomServerStatus getGroomToAllocate(Map<String,GroomServerStatus> groomStatuses,
                                                               String[] selectedGrooms,
                                                               Map<GroomServerStatus,Integer> taskCountInGroomMap,
                                                               BSPResource[] resources,
                                                               TaskInProgress taskInProgress)
        Returns the best groom to run the task on based on the set of grooms provided. The designer of the class can choose to populate the selectedGrooms value with the function selectGrooms
        Parameters:
        groomStatuses - The map of groom-name to GroomServerStatus object for all known grooms.
        selectedGrooms - An array of selected groom host-names to select from.
        taskCountInGroomMap - Map of count of tasks in groom (To be deprecated soon)
        taskInProgress - The TaskInProgress object for the task.
        Returns:
        Host Name of the selected groom. Returns null if no groom could be found.

      • getGroomsToAllocate

        @InterfaceStability.Unstable
Set<GroomServerStatus> getGroomsToAllocate(Map<String,GroomServerStatus> groomStatuses,
                                                                     String[] selectedGrooms,
                                                                     Map<GroomServerStatus,Integer> taskCountInGroomMap,
                                                                     BSPResource[] resources,
                                                                     TaskInProgress taskInProgress)
        Returns the best grooms to run the task on based on the set of grooms provided. The designer of the class can choose to populate the selectedGrooms value with the function selectGrooms
        Parameters:
        groomStatuses - The map of groom-name to GroomServerStatus object for all known grooms.
        selectedGrooms - An array of selected groom host-names to select from.
        taskCountInGroomMap - Map of count of tasks in groom (To be deprecated soon)
        taskInProgress - The TaskInProgress object for the task.
        Returns:
        Host Names of the selected grooms where the task could be allocated. Returns null if no groom could be found.
